Definition: Block programming is a style where visual blocks represent pieces of the computer code that can be manipulated through various forms of user input.
A region in a visual editor that contains information  about the code in the editor
A region in a visual editor that contains all of the lines of code in a user's program. The editor can be manipulated with the keyboard, the mouse, or through the block tray.
Text is any combination of written symbols, like letters or numbers.
A boolean variable can be only true or false
A variable is a storage container. It has a name, a data type, and a value.
